intro: Atelophragma ibapense, commonly known as the Ibadan spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
